title: Good software
comment: Best free replacement for the degraded for lolipop Logitech app

title: Great
comment: Good replacement for the Logitech player.

title: Alarms!
comment: The new alarm functionality is excellent!

title: Good, but needs filtering options
comment: Works really well, but is a bit annoying how it lumps in composers, conductors and bands (orchestras) in with the Artists. These are separate fields for a reason, and to lump them all together makes searches longer and annoying. This app needs to allow filtering of what appears in the Artist list.
The official Logitech app stopped working. Five seconds after clicking on install for Squeezer, i was browsing my music collection. Thanks!!

title: Great
comment: A couple of people have mentioned that a 'play from here' option when selecting a song in an album would be good - and I'd certainly welcome that. But it's still a great app - so many thanks to the developers!
Great

title: Exactly what you need
comment: Great app. Fast, well laid out, easy to use, all the features I need. Much better than logitech one. Like how it deals with synchronised groups. Reported bug with sleep timer and it was fixed in next release.
Much better design compared to the official one.  EDIT: Opted for beta, apps now work. Just gave my Squeezebox Duet a new lease of life.
Version 1.4.0, currently available to beta testers, improves apps support. You can try it by following the instructions at https://github.com/nikclayton/android-squeezer/wiki/Beta-testing.

title: It works
comment: Can't fault it, as Logitech can't be bothered to make their own app work on lollipop it's nice to see a developer show them how it's done.

title: Let's you listen, no bother.
comment: Everything works. Best free squeezebox controller. I've got nothing to complain about. I need nothing more.

title: Brilliant
comment: Works perfectly with the scan button and now enjoying a random shuffle. Thank you.
Best controller so far! Works great and the syncing of multiple squeezeboxes seems to work really well. Great job!

title: Faster than the Logitech app
comment: Very happy with this so far. The Logitech app stopped working for me under 5.1. This seems more responsive.

title: Like this app. It works.
comment: Logitech app stopped working. Maybe due to android update. This app works well so far. Works on Samsung tablet 8.4.

title: Good ui, but doesn't load apps
comment: Can't see my Pandora or Spotify apps anywhere.
Version 1.4.0, currently available to beta testers, improves apps support. You can try it by following the instructions at https://github.com/nikclayton/android-squeezer/wiki/Beta-testing.

title: Much better than the official one.
comment: The official app always has some kind of issue, especially with newer android builds but this just works exactly as it should. Excellent app.

title: Wow
comment: Wow what an amazing update, love it! All these updates are brilliant, it gets better and better, fantastic!
Best of the ones I've tried

title: Excellent but doesn't appear to work with apps
comment: Unfortunately doesn't play well with Triode's iPlayer and Spotify apps. But great otherwise.
Version 1.4.0, currently available to beta testers, improves apps support. You can try it by following the instructions at https://github.com/nikclayton/android-squeezer/wiki/Beta-testing.

title: Best app for your squeezebox needs
comment: Free, open source, great.

title: Works like a charm!
comment: Solid performance with functional UI.

title: Does the job
comment: Does what it says on the tin. Another happy user.

title: Suggestion;
comment: Great app! One suggestion; in browse mode, when I go back to main page, app goes to top of the list. If its go back to where I left, it will be better.

title: Alternative
comment: My old app squeezebox became defunct after 5.1.1...... This one seems to do OK...I will let u know more as I continue to use

title: Excellent
comment: Squeezer is much better than the Logitech app. The user interface is easier to use and I haven't had a crash (app or music server) since I started using it a few months ago, and I use it all the time.

title: Excellent
comment: Immediately on installing Squeezer I was very impressed with the speed and responsiveness.   Other apps I've used have had a tendency to grind to a halt when loading artwork,  but Squeezer does it very quickly. This is now my default squeezebox app.  Thanks!

title: Almost perfect
comment: Very close to the perfect controller for the squeeze box family players/servers. Especially now that the official app stopped working

title: Better than logitech
comment: Nice to see something new for this platform.

title: I cannot connect!
comment: I tried to  log both my Squeezebox and phone to wifi... but it cannot recognize the IP address... It kept saying "connection failed. Check settings.
Most of the basic features work fine but I really wish there is a option to manage the alarm clock part on a Squeezebox.

title: Better than Official
comment: The official app is slow and tends to crash regularly. This is faster and I've not had a crash. Primary difference is that this app sends commands over LAN rather than through logitech Internet servers. Album art as screensaver is a nice touch. 'Search' is not supported for Triode's Spotify app so 4 stars.

title: Can't access Apps
comment: Particularly Spotify...
Version 1.4.0, currently available to beta testers, improves apps support. You can try it by following the instructions at https://github.com/nikclayton/android-squeezer/wiki/Beta-testing.

title: Nicely done!
comment: Different from the Logitech official app (that no longer works on Lollipop) but better in many ways. Loads quickly,  easy swipe down access and all the important features. I will second Ben T's request for a "play from here" when browsing songs in an album or playlist. That's the one feature I miss from the official app.

title: App doesn't work
comment: Keep saying connection failed check setting, even when I put in the correct IP address

title: Excellent app. Hope it continues to improve.
comment: This is a great app. It's user-friendly and is bug-free. I'd like to see one feature added. When you start a album or playlist by tapping a song, play does not continue past that one song. I can work around it but an option for this would be nice. Perhaps there could be a "play from here" option in the song menu or an option in the settings menu to continue playing the rest of an album when a song ends.

title: So far awesomeness
comment: Works great..

title: Best squeezebox controller out there
comment: Where has this app been all my life?! This is this is the best squeezebox controller I've used - I Love it, and the new features keep coming...  Thanks!!

title: Excellent
comment: Works better than the Logitech app!

title: Great work!
comment: Any chance to move volume to the main screen instead of in menu?
You can also use your device's volume controls. We're looking in to including volume control on screen on devices with larger screens.

title: Awesome
comment: I'd gladly buy a pro version.
Excellent work! Reason to use my old (and brilliant) Roku Soundbridges again, as I can use my phone as remote..

title: Works flawlessly
comment: Much better than the Logitech app. Thanks!

title: Glad I discovered this
comment: I hadn't thought there would still be decent Squeezebox apps around and that we were all stuck with now-ancient tools doomed to incompatibility with new Android versions. But I was wrong!
Better than the Logitech app.

title: Can't search on Spotify
comment: ...so 4 stars instead of 5. Otherwise great replacement for the Logitech app

title: Good stuff
comment: Worked on both tab and old phones
Quick and easy to configure and use.

title: Replaced Logitech app
comment: The Logitech app has not been updated for ages and will not run on 5.1. Found this app that does everything I need. Great, wouldn't mind paying for it.
Thanks for keeping the platform alive! Agree with a previous comment, you should be on the Logitech payroll.

title: Logitech should be paying the Developer
comment: Love this app. We need a way to support the Dev. Donation app ?
Works very smoothly on all my android devices running 5+.

title: Works on Lollipop, could use better Pandora support
comment: Slicker than the Logitech app, but is lacking Pandora rate and skip buttons.
Skip buttons should work in 1.2.7 and above. If they don't then please get in touch (I don't use Pandora). Rating's on the TODO list.

title: Thank you!
comment: Logitech version doesn't work anymore and it was so frustrating until I found this app.  Works way better, thank you!

title: Great app
comment: It's a ton better than the Logitech version even when the Logitech one was working. Thank goodness it broke and led me here. Add some extra features and an unlocker and you have me as a supporter.

title: OK but needs shuffle play
comment: Not random shuffle; to shuffle a list of e.g. albums dumped into play now; or perhaps I just missed this option?
From the main screen, choose "Random mix", and the server will shuffle by your criteria.
Thank you, liking this ☺

title: Works just fine
comment: The Logitech app doesn't like lollipop - neither do I since it made my Nexus 7 sad - this controller works very nicely. Thanks to all involved

title: Works on lollipop
comment: Title says it all

title: Broken
comment: Won't work with Lollipop
That's odd, I develop on Lollipop. Can you provide more details?

title: Its fine for me
comment: I found this after the Logitech one stopped working. Its not quite as intuitive,  but it works.

A great alternative to the squeezebox app. Smooth scrolling and responsive. Volume control on device button is much easier to use than having to dive into the app. Download button is genius. Takes seconds to fill up new sd card from device rather than use PC to access server. Only want is to be able to change the location that app downloads to.

title: Nice
comment: At last a really good open source controller. Keep up the good work.

title: Squeezer, good replacement after lollipop
comment: Official logitech app no longer worked after upgrade to android 5.0.  After being lollipooped, I installed this and had music streaming again in less than 30 seconds...auto detected server, pressed play and we are back online...simple and effective.  Recommend if your official app is no longer functioning.

title: Excellent
comment: This is what the official app should be like. It works perfectly and quickly. Highly recommended.

title: Why did I wait so long?
comment: After an update to 5.1 on my nexus 5 borked the Logitech software, I tried this.  Wow, I feel like I wasted so much time messing with the other app when I could have been using this.

title: Great app
comment: Logitech app stopped working when I upgraded to Android 5. This is the best replacement I've found - and I've paid for one other app. Power on and off, playlists, browse folders, albums, artists: in short, all the function I want.

title: Good replacement for the Logitech App
comment: The original Logitech App simply hung at the splash screen. This one is simple to connect and does everything it should.

title: Missing Thumbs
comment: I like to use Squeezebox to listen o Pandora but there appears to be no way to rate songs

title: Better than official app
comment: The official app does not at present work on lollipop. So looking for an alternative for the future,I stumbled upon this app. What's not to like? Does ask the functions I use and it allows you to control all volumes of your players, just like ipeng, now if it had a peng party app... I cannot comment on plug ins as I don't use them yet, I'm too busy rediscovering my old CD collection, lol.

title: Better than official
comment: Excellent!

title: Best there is at the moment - but not perfect
comment: This does seem to work better and look better than the Logitech official. The only problem is that after about 20 or 30 tracks although it continues to show the correct track information it seems to give up on the cover art and just shows a blank icon.  The app could also be improved (and would be worth paying for) if you could choose what tags to display as part of the "now Playing" information. If your collection is specialist (e.g classical,, jazz)  it currently doesn't show the tags you want (composer, conductor etc) and there is no way to configure it to do so.
Cover art issue should be fixed now. Please let me know if you see it again. Still thinking about the best way to allow tag customisation.

title: Scrolling nightmare.
comment: I go to Music Folder and then FLAC folder and when I scroll down after 20 or so folders the names disappear as if the app is building the database ... EACH AND EVERY TIME. If you minimize and bring it up and hit back to get back to the artist folder (if you were browsing an album by that artist) it goes back to root folder. Annoying. Other than that, never crashed or gave trouble. Just too sluggish with huge libraries.
The best in the category

title: Widget
comment: Why bother? What advantage does this provide over the Logitech app? No alarm....? Give me a play/pause/albumart widget at least and stop wasting my time :p

1.2.8-beta-1 and above include support for playback controls on the device's lockscreen. See https://github.com/nikclayton/android-squeezer/wiki/Beta-testing for information on how to join the beta test programme for early access.

title: Great Stuff
comment: This works brilliantly connecting to my RaspberryPi based squeeze server and happily syncs and controls my Logitech Radio and Boom players.
Works well

title: Excellent remote app
comment: Just wish all albums and artwork would store locally constant waiting after scrolling is painful this true off all apps of this type
Awesome app
Has the potential to surpass ipeng some day.

title: Solid controller
comment: Finally!   Stable and fast!! Thanks for pulling this together ..

title: Superb. Minor things
comment: Superb app!! Minor things: 1) empty cover in radio stations  a bit ugly. 2) icon of the players dont show for my classic in the players view. 3) topleft icon somehow a bit small to get back to main menu. 4) switch library button would be nice

title: Apps
comment: Looks good, but no support for apps, like the YouTube app :( I would fully move over to this if apps support was added.

title: Best free Squeezebox controller
comment: Too bad it doesn’t work well with apps such as Deezer

title: All except app support
comment: Please make it so we can thumbs up and thumbs down tracks on Pandora and skip tracks.
Best out there

title: Great Support !
comment: Only asked about the Players not showing in older android devices (gingerbread) yesterday and it's fixed already !   Great to have the best Squeezebox controller back working again. Thanks !

title: Very good
comment: The app has some better feature and some not as good as squeezebox app.

title: Love it
comment: Great App, certainly the best available for our Squeezebox. What would be a great improvement, however, is the preloading of the My Music folder. This way I could scroll through my music and would not have to wait for folder names to load. It's a minor nuisance, but something that annoys me once in a while.

title: Refuses to connect to server
comment: For some reason it refuses go connect to my LMS (Zyxel NSA310). Scan finds correct IP address easily.

See if the Command Line Interface is enabled on your Squeezeserver ("Settings", "Advanced" tab, and choose "Command Line Interface (CLI)"). We can try and diagnose further if you post a message to https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/android-squeezer. Thanks.

title: Good
comment: Just missing support for apps. It works good when I'm just browsing my library.

title: Good app, annoying notification
comment: Now using Squeezer instead of Squeeze Commander which I had been using for the last 3 years. Better looking, more intuitive interface. Does everything you would expect. However, it's very annoying to have to disconnect before quitting (or force-close) in order to get rid of the notification.
Does the job.

title: Amazing squeezebox controller
comment: The best app on my phone! Would be perfect if it had an integrated player... Free and beautiful!

title: Finally a good frontend
comment: Works like charm with my Transporter. I have the Squeezebox-server running on a qnap-nas and mainly use local files and Internet-radio. Just installed it but I like it.

title: Need sync controls and now playing widgets but good.
comment: More reliable than orange squeezer for me.

title: Best yet
comment: Rock solid. And open source. Not sure what changed but the "now playing" info is now correctly updated in the notifications! Great work!
Great app

title: Excellent app
comment: Does exactly what it's supposed to do. I think the notification system should be a separate service though, that can be disabled from the settings. In my opinion. That way you wouldn't have to confirm a disconnect anymore, when closing the app.

title: More functionality than a paid app
comment: Great app. Found my server straight off. Woyld be great to see support for more third party apps

title: Awesome controller app, but no synchronisation?
comment: Well done on such a great squeeze controller! Works incredibly well and is free!! I would really like to have the ability to synchronise playback between players, appears its only possible to control each player independently. Many thanks, Rob.
Testing
Yves, the username and password are optional. If your server doesn't need one then don't enter one.

title: Nice
comment: Looks cool, works great

title: Five Stars
comment: ... enough said.

title: Missing...
comment: ...app support. I use my squeezeboxen to stream Google All Access Music via a plugin installed in LMS. Can't access the plugin via Squeezer.

title: Better by far than Logitech's slug of an app!
comment: I'd given up with the sluggish Logitech app and  reverted to the Squeezebox IR remote. And then I found Squeezer. It's quick, reliable and is worth downloading just for the volume control function alone! Very impressed.

title: Very good
comment: Using it with Daphile and it works really nice!
Does this have access to my apps? I'm I just blind?

My Apps support is coming in the next version, to be released very soon. If you'd like to try the beta version before it's released, join the community at https://plus.google.com/u/0/communities/104836508948545556562, and then click this link to opt-in to the beta programme: https://play.google.com/apps/testing/uk.org.ngo.squeezer

title: Nice
comment: Very nice

title: Small, fast, easy: pick three
comment: Finally a squeezebox client which works well instead of the bloated Logitech app!

title: Nice layout...but probs remaining connected
comment: Works nicely, and a good clean interface. However, with my setup (LMS with Raspberry Pi running PiCorePlayer acting as headless Squeezebox) I have problems with losing the connection to the current state. If I set an album playing, then let my Nexus5 lock itself, if I then open up Squeezer again the play status is frozen. I had thought it was to do with my Pi setup, but I discovered that if I do a Disconnect and then Reconnect, it comes back to life.  Apart from this, it's brill!  Any help/suggestions?

title: Smart layout and responsive
comment: But no way to queue all results of a search except one by one...

title: Excellent and easy!
comment: Install, scan, sorted!  One little (maybe?) feature request, though: can you integrate the "now playing" notification with Android, the same way YouTube does when "casting" to a TV? Then you can use the lock-screen to play/pause/skip, etc.

title: Good
comment: Still trying it out. Will update more later

title: Works nicely
comment: Great app and no adverts! The benefits of good open source

title: Simple elegance!
comment: Works good, but I use Spotify 90% of the time (Internet Radio 10%) and I seriously lack the possibility to queue Spotify playlists - There's no such option as far as I can tell!? Fix that I'll give this app five stars!!

title: Great app
comment: Been using the default app and gave this one a try.....really impressed. Much more responsive

title: Finally!
comment: I've tried every android SB controller app and they're all slow, unstable, and flawed - except this one! I love it!

title: Works very well.
comment: Smooth and quick performance, accesses all aspects of Squeezebox Boom - both internet favorites and local library, volume and power on, etc.  And, no "account" needed.  Has surpassed "Squeeze Controller" in functionality.

title: Love this app
comment: This app is just done right. Everything I want to do always seems to be right at my fingertips. I always found myself stumbling through menus with the Logitech squeezebox app to get where I wanted to be. Excellent work!
Like the app but am really missing support for MyApps as I am using Spotify all the time. Please add this and this will be full pott.
Does everything I need to control my Squeezeboxes
No sync, and stays memory resident for some reason

title: Missing Spotify support
comment: As mentioned by others, support for My Apps (in my case mainly Spotify) makes it a no go for me now. Any ideas of adding it in the future?

title: Good alternative to Squeeze Commander
comment: Very good,  but several features could be added eg wake-on-lan,  app support,  faster artwork loading (caching)
Great app. Does everything I need it to

title: Very good, but it lacks support from My Apps.
comment: Best app for controlling a Squeezebox, however I cannot use it as my first option since it lacks support for My Apps. It would be great to see it implemented.

title: Good
comment: It's good, I like the interface but one cannot play the squeezebox apps like digitally imported etc as far I can tell. Other apps allow this.  Also, it will spin attempting to reconnect to server forever if there is a network issue

title: Getting good
comment: New version much better. Not as good as the best, but free!

title: Won't connect
comment: Doesn't connect to my LMS.

title: Squeezeboxes still being supported!
comment: I installed this app ages ago, and only recently opened it up again after moving house. When did it get so pretty? A really slick app, especially considering it's totally free. Lovely stuff chaps.

title: Is already quite good
comment: Really needs a direct power on/off button on each line in the List-of-Players view. Is now unlogically hidden in the menu. (Sq.server 7.5.x) Hmm, after using it a bit longer I take away two stars. Why? Since it keeps forcing the wrong "now playing" text on the player. I don't want it to influence my player.

title: Horrible
comment: Will anybody review this?

title: Works really well, but needs app support.
Does not connect
comment: Does not connect to a password protected system

The latest version of Squeezer supports a password protected Squeezebox Server.
If you have any problems please post an issue on http://code.google.com/p/android-squeezer/issues/list, and we will be happy to assist you.

title: No connection
comment: Scan finds server but fails to connect. Official app works fine.

title: Excellent so far!
comment: Great interface for my squeezebox installation, and it is great to finally have a really good Open Source app for this server - since the squeezebox server is Open Source too. Keep up the good work.

title: Better than official software....
comment: ..... From Logitech.  But Orange Squeeze has more and better features.  Orange is a better alternative for me.   Still a good app.

title: The new version is simply amazing!
comment: Stable, fast and it has ALL features of the paid alternatives! It reminds me to an Orange B-). Works excellently on tablets also. I have just one simple wish: default player settings would be realy nice. I have three SBs, but usually i would like to control the last one in the alphabet :-) Keep up the great work !

title: Wow...
comment: This is the app that Logitech should have written.  It makes finding music and radio streams much easier.  If you are using the Logitech/Squeeze Media Server, you should be using this app.  And, if you have remote controls, be sure to put them somewhere safe, since you're not going to be using them again.

title: Excellent, but lacks app support.
comment: I'd like to control spotify with this remote, but there's no support for apps (yet?)

title: Great app
comment: This app is great. Two improvement suggestions 1) Ability to choose / change synchronization between players (can't find this anywhere in this app) 2) Easy way to turn on/off players from the selection screen itself rather than selecting each and then turning on/off from options - pretty annoying when using 4 players all around the house.

title: Well done
comment: Better than the "official" App
Great update

title: Perfect
comment: Perfect update thanks.. Can you ad so you can paste url to radio or other "media.mp3"

title: Nice improvements
comment: Much nicer but no song select actions work when clicking a song in my music folder after changing it in the settings menu to any value other than "none"

Hi. Sorry that feature's not working for you. I've just checked on my system here, and it's working fine. Could you provide more details, by going to https://code.google.com/p/android-squeezer/issues/entry and filling out the form there. Hopefully we can get to the bottom of what the problem is.
Excellent!

title: Excellent
comment: Recent update is phenomenally good. Best squeezebox controller I've used.

title: Brilliant update
comment: Imagine if the music could pause when the phone rang, :-)

I've thought about it.  The only thing that stops me doing it is Squeezer would need the READ_PHONE_STATE permission, which shows a scary warning to users (see http://android.stackexchange.com/questions/48709/read-phone-state-and-identity) and I'm concerned that users would be more likely to not install Squeezer.  Thoughts?

title: Limited features and only single player support?
comment: As subject; very limited and is showing tracks from a player that isn't playing and not the one I'm listening to. Can't find a way to switch players. May also have caused a device lockup and seems to be seriously affecting device performance. Can only give one star right now, sorry!

For the latest version (on large screens), there is an on-screen player list button, otherwise it will be in the options menu. 
If you still have problems, you are welcome to post an issue on http://code.google.com/p/android-squeezer/issues.
We have no reports of lockup or performance issues, but again you may post an issue with additional info.
I love it. The interface could be iimproved
Good lightweight player!

title: Excellent
comment: Under active development (see their website) and the couple of minor problems I found are already fixed and will be in the next release.

If you'd like to try the beta version before it's released, join the community at https://plus.google.com/u/0/communities/104836508948545556562, and then click this link to opt-in to the beta programme: https://play.google.com/apps/testing/uk.org.ngo.squeezer

title: Free & open SqueezeBox app with superior UX
comment: If you own a SqueezeBox, you want to install this. Much quicker startup, and a more intuitive interface than Logitech's app. Just missing a widget.
Tried 5 apps and this is the one that's easy clean and sensible.  great freeware.

title: Limited functionality
comment: Menu shows only Now Playing, My music, Internet Radio, and Favorites. that's it... No apps, shoutcast or anything. But it's fast and works.

If you'd like to try the beta version before it's released, join the community at https://plus.google.com/u/0/communities/104836508948545556562, and then click this link to opt-in to the beta programme: https://play.google.com/apps/testing/uk.org.ngo.squeezer

title: Very fast
comment: Using it with squeeze box radios connected to a to raspberry pi server running squeeze-plug.

title: thanks!
comment: works great with LMS on LAN, other controllers wanted to connect to my LMS account and couldn't see my players.

title: Works great. I miss shuffle though
comment: Better and faster than Logitech's own app on my phone at least, does the same.

Shuffle will be in the next version, released very soon.  If you'd like to try the beta version before it's released, join the community at https://plus.google.com/u/0/communities/104836508948545556562, and then click this link to opt-in to the beta programme: https://play.google.com/apps/testing/uk.org.ngo.squeezer

title: Better than official app
comment: This works really well. It starts quickly which the official app fails to do and works smoothly, providing a great interface to my squeeze devices.

title: Useless
comment: Doesn't connect to the server, offers no explanation. Complete waste of time to download and install.

title: Best free app
comment: Cannot ask for more as it is free. ; ) Possible to return to where it was when exit from a folder? Need to scroll all the way down again every time after picking songs.
Does not work with password protected server

Password support is in the next version, which is in beta now.  If you'd like to try the beta version before it's released, join the community at https://plus.google.com/u/0/communities/104836508948545556562, and then click this link to opt-in to the beta programme: https://play.google.com/apps/testing/uk.org.ngo.squeezer

title: OK
comment: Needs setting on albums to have default action browse. Actually, don't have play on a single touch at all, I keep accidently starting playback of things when something is already playing and I only want to add to current playlist, not overwrite it.

Exactly that feature is in the next version, which is in beta now. If you'd like to try the beta version before it's released, join the community at https://plus.google.com/u/0/communities/104836508948545556562, and then click this link to opt-in to the beta programme: https://play.google.com/apps/testing/uk.org.ngo.squeezer

title: Perfect for my purpose
comment: This is the best app that I have found and I did so after trying free and paid for apps. My main purpose was to be able to access my server remotely over the 3G network. This is the only app that was straightforward to configure and also gives me perfect control over my music.

title: Great
comment: Great

title: Free!
comment: Great app. Searches quickly. Scrolls quickly. Displays cover art. Can control multiple units. Volume control works fine for me. Best of all. It's free!

title: Almost perfection
comment: Just one real annoyance. When youre playing a track from an album why can't you use the back button to go back to the album list? Pressing the back button just ends the app.

title: Excellent app
comment: Have tried all the free squeezebox apps and this is by far the best. Easy to use, nice interface and good display of album artwork on now playing. Volume control is a little over sensitive but no big deal.

title: Excellent
comment: I'm very impressed. Volume controls and everything all work fine

title: Excellent!  But ...
comment: Super app - but really needs a soft volume control.  My tablet buttons for this arre way too insensitive - goes from whisper to ear-shattering in a flash.  Ouch!
1.0.0, just released, has a menu option for volume control (as well as support for the hardware buttons).

title: Solid basic controller
comment: Easy to navigate my music collection.  Much quicker than Logitech's controller app.  + open source.

title: ok
comment: no volume control. uninstall

title: Nice starting point
comment: But would like to see access to apps like Pandora and Spotify. The My Music section loads quickly and browsing for music is quick.

title: Way better than official app
comment: I got fed up with the official app being buggy and slow. This app works great on dell streak. Only impovments  would be suffle and repeat. And more track infomation.

title: Great start
comment: Solid start. Need shuffle playlist, volume control, jump to current track in playlist view, new music link, etc.
Has some way to go but it looks like it will be THE app for squeezebox.

title: No new music
comment: Good. Needs a bit more work. Especially ability to browse "new music" list.
Like it so far
Does what the official app should.

title: Reasonable start - looking good
comment: Needs mysqueezebox switch. Needs apps. Good start looking forward to updates

title: Work in progress
comment: The basics are there. It's missing authentication and access to favorites. Volume control on the "now playing" screen would be nice too.
Favourites, authentication, and volume control (from the action bar menu) are all in the 1.0.0 release.
